title: Rune pages should be cheaper for IP to start with, but scale up to 6300 as you buy more.
body:
Even just being able to get one for 1350 IP, then one for 3150, for 4800, and then 6300 for the rest. Hell, even just getting the first one half off would be SOMETHING.

I know someone will try to tell me that two pages is plenty, but it's really not if you intend to learn more than one role, which you kinda have to now that auto-fill is the norm.

Especially with T2 runes being 1 IP, giving newer accounts a fairly large variety of runes on the cheap.

> Also the fact that the higher runes and most champs are costly

There are 77 champions in the 4800+ IP price range.

That's over half the champions in the game, never mind the fact that a good chunk of the cheaper champions are outdated and in need of reworks.

Technically if your goal is just to buy every champ champ in no particular order you just have to buy all the 4800 and lower champs, then buy and reroll 3 champ shards to get the 6300 champs (Which is only a cost of 5100)

Just putting it out there that the total price of champions is a good chunk lower than most people think.  Still crazy expensive though and I agree with cutting down the price of the first few rune pages.

Like I said though, you need to play this game a LOT before its fun. I'm not talking about buying rune pages or getting to level 30 neither, I'm talking about actually getting good at the game, it takes quite a while to do that for the average player, so a time sink is needed to make sure that the player can actually have fun after they spend the correct amount of time after playing.

If the game handed you things from the get go you wouldn't have a clue about them and would get frustrated, but if you sink your efforts into acheiving them you have an obligation to do research and try and build good things, which in turn will force you to become a better player as well.

I'm sure riot understands this. and it will essentially stay the same until proper tutorials come out, and by proper tutorials I'm talking a full fledged singleplayer at the least because it REALLY takes a blasted long time to understand the game.

More rune pages are not necessary, just convenient.
Having the runes to fill those pages is the most important part and that costs a boatload of IP, before you factor in costs of champions.

There are even proven "useless" runes and ones that are "optimal". So the variety might add a degree of fun, but when you analyze it, it falls flat on intended output. It might not be the difference between bronze and silver, but it might be he difference between diamond and challenger in some cases. If the gameplay is as high tier as expected, the raw stats feeding into outputs can have the world of difference.

I like the idea of customizable stats via runes, but the costs associated are just a sink unfortunately.
Remember, Riot hates money, so they try to avoid making incentives to purchase things with RP.
While I agree they should be cheaper, I don't agree it's needed.  I see many high ELO streamers that have 2-3 rune pages.
